name: Novotel Forest Resort Creswick

reviews.text: This is the second time we have stayed at Novotel Forest resort. My wife and I stay about two years ago and it was excellent nice new rooms wonderful food and a golf course just great (even though quite young). After having a great time we decided to bring my wife's sister and her husband for a weekend away together. It was embarrassing we had pumped this place up so much and it has changed so much since our first stay. The food was over priced and so slow and when finally arrived it was substandard. The heating didn't work it was freezing my wife was forced to sleep in her clothes to keep warm. The golf course has just been let go the fairways and overall condition of the course has really gone downhill since our first visit 2 years ago. The whole resort appears to have lost it's shine and the general upkeep of the place has been neglected. I noticed part of the car park had been cordoned off for repairs 2 years ago and it was still there second time round. From a outsider this place looks like it is going broke. Won't be coming back to this place in a hurry it is an embarrassment to the usual good Novotel name.
reviews.title: This place looks like it's going broke
Would go there again
reviews.text: OK.. To be quite honest its is a nice place (maybe because its only 3 years old at the time we stayed there April 2011) First night room service was a disgrace. First they brought my wife the wrong dinner then second time round they brought her the right one but missing the main ingrediant ( the chicken) then they brought the dry tasteless chicken on a plate for my wife to stuff it in her wholemeal roll herself as opposed to making her a completley fresh one.. Very poor service from that point of view.. As far as the rooms were concerned the vanity units had no soap holders so that made washing a bit of a mess. There were no teatowels supplied in the kittchenettes. As well as no dishwashing detergent. The spiders on the balcony didnt make it very comfotrtable to go ouside without worrying that there was goning to be a spider crawling up your back by the time you went back inside. The staff there were quite friendly but i would say the food would be less than complinmentary... Out of ten our stay was 3.5

reviews.title: escape the city
reviews.text: friend and i enjoyed staying at the hotel it was very relaxing. the fine dinning was great with staff always happy to help. creswick was quite and enjoyable which was a great change to the city life. would stay again with my kids and husband.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we booked on wotif 2 nights including breakfast and complimentary bottle of sparkling wine on arrival.never been to creswick before.its about 12 k north of ballarat,quite a new complex.hotel room was modern and spotless.very comfy king bed ,bathroom has a shower over a regular shape bath which is a spa .our room was the smallest type that is available but still totally acceptable. included couch (pull out extra bed) and desk area.buffet breakfast was good but needs a rethink on the layout when its busy .everyone gets crowded into the 1 corner after hot food,toasters and then the staff have to try and make their way through to refill the hot dishes.the restaurant was very nice for dinner -an interesting selection,best to book during holidays,staff friendly.there is a casual sports bar cafewith sports tv for less complicated meals which overlooks a golf tee.can be entertaining to watch! golf is 18 holes for $40 plus $20 for the cart-recommended as its a slightly hilly course.there is also a swimming pool.we went to the creswick little market on the saturday morning ,visited clunes that day as well (another pretty little town)1 night dinner at smokey town cafe in creswick-very good and sunday went to the charming talbot "whole town" market and stocked up on a bit of everything.if you check the dates for the markets this is a relaxing way to get away. visit the museums ,bookshops ,the second hand and also the junk shops.went to creswick woollen mills,they have alpacas in a paddock there.
reviews.title: go to creswick and leave your worries behind for the weekend!
Poor second time around
reviews.text: My partner stayed at the Novotel in March, and loved it so much we decided to return in April. The second time around the service was appaling. The room was fantastic, cleaning staff were great, but as there is not much to do around Creswick, the main place to have your meals is in the Novotel Resturants. The service in the resturants was extreemly slow, we waited for over two hour and the quality of the food was poor once it arrived. Normaly i would not mind paying over $30 for a quality meal, but to wait for two hours and then be given crap, it was not on! Overall, the bad dining experience at the Novotel ruined our stay! I loved the hotel for its facilities, but dont eat there!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights in this hotel on our way south . We had great expectations and were let down by the many small issues that could so easily be addressed. Our first disappointment was that our room overlooked the carpark. When we booked I had assumed that a Superior room would have the view that others had spoken about. No! Our room had a King bed and sofa. To get the view you have to be in a room with TWO king beds - can't see why you would need that unless you are travelling with children!
reviews.title: Nice hotel with small problems..

reviews.text: Next problem was NO information in the room at all - no compendium with general or more specific information on what to get and where, pillow menu, TV instructions, restaurants, meal times etc.
reviews.title: Nearly perfect...
Family Reunion
reviews.text: Movies didn't work in our room when we arrived and took three phone calls and a visit from a lovely young man named James to get it working - just on that note the movie selection was the best we had seen in many hotel visits.

reviews.title: A quick break
reviews.text: I felt that there were a lot of small things lacking in the room itself : ONE face washer, not two, No shower cap - found out later that you they hide them at reception ( note about this would have helped) , tiny cups only really suited to be used witha teapot or plunger - neither of these available only instant coffee and poor selection of tea bags , Very small cupboard with no space for clothes, huge bed with only one extra pillow etc etc .

reviews.title: Our stay in the forest
reviews.text: We needed a place in near western Victoria to explore the goldfields area. Novotel Forest Resort met our expectations, particularly from the helpful and friendly staff attitudes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for a quiet relaxing long weekend getaway. The resort is set in the middle of a golf course so is very quiet. The executive room was very roomy, including a gas "log" fireplace. The swimming pool and gym were quite small for a resort of this size. We were also disappointed to discover on arrival that the day spa was already fully booked for the whole 4 days, book in advance if want to use the day spa.
reviews.title: Excellant resort hotel in Victorian countryside
Great resort - Looking forward to our next visit!
reviews.text: Staff were really friendly, room was spacious and comfortable, In-room SPA bath was amazing, nice environment - fresh air, great view ...
The (Forest) Golf course looks really nice ... and you can take a walk or ride in the forest too ...
reviews.title: A hidden haven

description: Situated on 150 acres of state forest in the Victorian Spa Country, the Novotel Forest Resort Creswick is a 4.5 star hotel perfect for a holiday or weekend getaway, with a conference centre for up to 600 people making it ideal for meetings and events. Located 11 km from Ballarat, near Daylesford and Hepburn Springs, the resort features a boutique day spa, gym, outdoor heated swimming pool, an a la carte restaurant, bar, and a Tony Cashmore designed championship 18 hole golf course. All 143 rooms and suites feature balconies, king beds and spa baths.
